=== Organisational Structure ===

ubuntu-ch members have equal privileges and opportunities. As Switzerland has, although a small country, no less than 4 official languages with a wealth of dialects and variations, the official communication language of our LoCo is English. For most Swiss Ubuntu-users, support and information in their own (main) language is provided by parts of our community. A contact list is available on our wiki page:

* <nowiki>[[SwissTeam-RegionalContacts|Regional Contacts in Switzerland]]</nowiki>

== Activities ==

We distinguish between regular meetings and special events.

=== Regular Meetings ===

There is a regular monthly meeting of the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SwissTeam/Meetings|Ubuntu Community]]</nowiki> in Zurich. It is very vital and funny. Usually ~15 people show up there. At the meeting we have presentations on various topics around Ubuntu and Free Software (e.g. Ubuntu Phone Status Update) and do the planning for upcoming events like the Ubucon.

=== Events ===

==== Ubucon ====

We regularly organize so called Ubucons. This year we decided to only organize an Ubucon for LTS releases, so the next one is planned for 2016.

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="border:none;"><nowiki>[[File:ubucon01.jpg|Ubucon - Photo 1 |align="left", width="400px"]]</nowiki>

|}

To get some more impressions of the last Ubucon for LTS 14.04, please visit:

* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SwissTeam/Ubucon14?action=show&redirect=SwissTeam%2FUbucon|Ubucon 14]]</nowiki> 'Trusty Tahr' in Bern
* <nowiki>[[http://www.rum3ber.ch/index.php/galerie/category/136-05-ubucon | Images gallery of Ubucon 14]]</nowiki>

==== Fêtons Linux ====

There is another big event organized by the LoCo which is Fêtons Linux. It happens in the French-speaking part of Switzerland, commonly in Geneva. The next Fêtons Linux is scheduled for 2015/11/28. Please take a look at the <nowiki>[[http://www.fetonslinux.ch/|Fêtons Linux]]</nowiki> homepage for further information.

== Roadmap ==

The Swiss Loco Team aims to promote Ubuntu and its flavors in Switzerland. This is done through:

* Install parties
* Stands at fairs
* Presentations and speeches at various events
* Giving support, CDs and info in the various Swiss regions, in all Swiss languages + English. See also the list of <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SwissTeam/RegionalContacts|local contact]]</nowiki> persons grouped by location.
* Active collaboration in translations into German, French, Italian and hopefully Romansh.

=== Ubucon ===

An Ubucon for the next LTS version of Ubuntu (16.04) is on the roadmap. The idea is to organize the Ubucon in different parts of Switzerland. We already have been in Winterthur, Zurich and Bern. A potential location is Basel, as it's nearby the southern part of Germany as well. We are already in contact with the location provider and it looks good at the moment.

Besides that we are thinking about hosting the big <nowiki>[[http://ubucon.eu|European Ubucon]]</nowiki> in 2018 for the 18.04 LTS Release.
